com.nimsoft.nimbus
Class NimSecurity

java.lang.Object
  com.nimsoft.nimbus.NimSecurityBase
      com.nimsoft.nimbus.NimSecurity

public class NimSecurity
extends NimSecurityBase

Security class used for secure Nimbus transport. The two main parts used are TwoFish and MD5

encrypt

public String encrypt(String seed,
                      String string)
               throws NimException
Deprecated. Use encryptUTF8 instead. Note that strings encrypted with this function and encryptUTF8 are not compatible.

Encrypt a string using Two-fish and encode the answer in Base64.

Parameters:
string - The string to be encrypted
seed - The seed
Returns:
The encrypted string
Throws:
NimException - never thrown in practice - was part of the original method signature and exists now for backward compatibility.

encryptISO

public String encryptISO(String seed,
                         String plaintext)
                  throws NimException
Deprecated. Use encryptUTF8 instead. ISO-8859-1 cannot represent all characters (Japanese and Chinese characters in particular). Note that strings encrypted with this function are not fully compatible with encryptUTF8 (characters within the ASCII range are compatible).

Encrypt a string using the Twofish algorithm and encode the encrypted bytes using Base64. The ISO-8859-1 character set will be used to transform the given string to a byte array, which is encrypted and then encoded using Base64.

Parameters:
seed - the seed for the twofish algorithm
plaintext - the string to encrypt
Returns:
The encrypted string
Throws:
NimException - if the ISO-8859-1 charset is not supported by the JVM (never really thrown in practice since ISO-8859-1 is a standard JVM charset).

encryptUTF8

public String encryptUTF8(String seed,
                          String plaintext)
Encrypt a string using the Twofish algorithm and encode the encrypted bytes using Base64.

The UTF-8 character set will be used to transform the given plain-text string to a byte array, which is encrypted and then encoded using Base64.

Parameters:
seed - the seed for the twofish algorithm
plaintext - the string to encrypt
Returns:
the encrypted string
Since:
2.88

encrypt

public String encrypt(String seed,
                      String plaintext,
                      String charset)
               throws UnsupportedEncodingException
Encrypt a plain-text string. Since the twofish encryption algorithm operates on bytes, a character set to convert the given plain-text String to a byte array must be specified. The character set is used to convert both the seed for the Twofish algorithm and the given plain-text String into byte arrays.

Parameters:
seed - the seed for the twofish algorithm
plaintext - the string to encrypt
charset - the character set to use to convert the seed and the plain-text string to byte arrays. If null, the platform default character set will be used (not recommended!)
Returns:
the encrypted String, as Base64 encoded bytes
Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the given character set is not supported by the JVM.
Since:
2.88

decrypt

public String decrypt(String seed,
                      String string)
               throws NimException
Deprecated. the platform default character set may not be the same as the character set that was used to encrypt the string

Decrypt some already Twofish encrypted and Base64 encoded text and return the "original" string. This uses the platform default character set to convert the decrypted bytes into a Java String.

Parameters:
string - The string to be decrypted
seed - The seed
Returns:
The decrypted string
Throws:
NimException
See Also:
decryptUTF8(String, String)

Decrypt some already Twofish encrypted and Base64 encoded text and return the "original" string.

seed - The seed
Returns:
The decrypted string
Throws:
NimException - if the Base64 encoded string contains illegal characters.

                          String encrypted)
                   throws NimException

Parameters:
seed - the seed for the twofish algorithm
encrypted - the string to decrypt

the decrypted string

NimException - if the Base64 encoded string contains illegal characters.

encryptUTF8(String, String)

decrypt

public String decrypt(String seed,
                      String encrypted,
                      String charset)
               throws NimException,
                      UnsupportedEncodingException
Decrypt an encrypted string.

The encrypted string is first decoded (from Base64 encoding) to a byte array, then decrypted (Twofish), and then converted to a Java String using the given character set.

The character set is used to convert the given "seed" string to a byte array for use by the Twofish algorithm, and also to convert the decrypted bytes into a Java String.

Parameters:
seed - the seed used by twofish
encrypted - the encrypted bytes, encoded as a Base64 String
charset - the character set to use to convert the seed and the encrypted string to byte arrays
Returns:
the decrypted (plain text) string
Throws:
NimException - if the Base64 encoded string contains illegal characters.
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the given character set is not supported by the JVM.
Since:
2.88

               throws NimException

encrypt

public PDS encrypt(PDS pds)
            throws NimException
Encrypt a PDS.

This method will use the PDS encoding character set to convert the given PDS to bytes, which will then be encrypted (see PDS.getEncoding()).

Consider using encrypt(PDS, String) to specify the character set to use to convert Strings in the PDS to bytes that will then be encrypted.

Parameters:
pds - The PDS to be encrypted
Returns:
A encrypted PDS
Throws:
NimException
See Also:
encrypt(PDS, String)

encrypt

public PDS encrypt(PDS pds,
                   String charset)
            throws NimException,
                   UnsupportedEncodingException
Encrypt the given PDS using the given character set.

The PDS is encrypted by first converting it to a byte array, then encrypting those bytes. We need to specify the character encoding so that we won't lose information while converting Strings that are contained within the PDS into bytes.

Other components may need to be able to decrypt the PDS as well, which requires that they know the character set to use for decryption (so that Strings within the PDS can be created properly).

Parameters:
pds - the PDS to encrypt
charset - the character set to use to convert the given pds to a byte array suitable for encryption.
Returns:
the encrypted PDS
Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the given charset is not supported by the JVM.
NimException
Since:
2.88

decrypt

public PDS decrypt(PDS pdsencrypted)
            throws NimException
Decrypt a PDS.

The PDS will be created from the decrypted bytes using the PDS decoding character set (see PDS.getDecoding()) to create Strings from byte arrays.

Consider using decrypt(PDS, String) to specify the character set to use to create Java Strings from the decrypted bytes.

Parameters:
pdsencrypted - The PDS to be decrypted
Returns:
A decrypted PDS
Throws:
NimException - if the decoding character set is not supported by the JVM or the decrypted bytes do not form a well-defined PDS.
See Also:
decrypt(PDS, String)

decrypt

public PDS decrypt(PDS encrypted,
                   String charset)
            throws NimException,
                   UnsupportedEncodingException
Decrypt a PDS, using the given character set to interpret encrypted bytes as Java String objects.

Parameters:
encrypted - the PDS with encrypted contents.
charset - the character set to use to interpret Strings when creating the decrypted PDS.
Returns:
the decrypted PDS.
Throws:
NimException - if the PDS bytes are not well-formed.
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the given character set is not supported by the JVM.
Since:
2.88

base64Encrypt

public PDS base64Encrypt(PDS pds)
                  throws NimException
Base64 encrypt a PDS. This uses the PDS encoding character set (see PDS.getEncoding()) to convert Java Strings to bytes, which are then Base64 encrypted.

Parameters:
pds - The PDS to be encrypted
Returns:
The encrypted PDS
Throws:
NimException
